Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 52411: Direct Life, Health, and Medical Insurance Carriers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The SEC brought an enforcement action against insurance companies with securities fraud for facilitating market timing of mutual funds through the sale of variable annuities.

Description: Conseco agreed to pay a $500,000 penalty in settlement of allegations it failed to deal with claims in a fair and timely manner.

Info Source: State agency levies big fine, keeps details secret, Associated Press, April 4, 2007 (via Nexis).

Description: Conseco paid the state $75,000 and agreed to provide an estimated $7.2 million in interest rate reductions to customers as part of a settlement of allegations that it charged excessive interest rates and engaged in harassment.
Agency: Kansas Office of the State Bank Commissioner
Info Source: CONSECO CLIENTS TO GET $7.2 MILLION, Wichita Eagle, February 22, 2002 (via Nexis).

Description: Bankers Life agreed to pay a $400,000 penalty and pay $100,000 to senior citizen organizations in settlement of allegations it failed to adequately train and supervise producers, leading to a large number of customer complaints and alleged violations.
Notes: The copy of the Order available on agency webpage is undated
The copy of the Order available on agency webpage is undated

Description: Bankers Life agreed to pay a $500,000 penalty in settlement of allegations it failed to supervise producers that were found to have used unfair solicitation methods.
Notes: The copy of the Order available on agency webpage is undated

Description: Conseco Life Insurance agreed to pay a $250,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations it misrepresented the terms of its insurance policies and failed to determine the suitability of its policies at time of sale, in violation of state statues.

Washington National Insurance Co. agreed to pay a $140,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations it misrepresented the terms of 72 life insurance policies, failed to determine the policies' suitability, and provided the Department of Commerce with incomplete and inaccurate information.

Company: Bankers Life and Casualty Co. and Colonial Penn Life Insurance Co.
Bankers Life and Casualty Co. and Colonial Penn Life Insurance Co.
Description: Bankers Life and Casualty Co. and Colonial Penn Life Insurance Co. agreed to pay a $175,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations they sold unsuitable insurance products with lack of supervision of products sold, advertisements, and insurance producers.

Bankers Life agreed to pay $200,000 to the Investor Education and Protection Fund, $14,180 in costs, and $575,420 in disgorgement of commission, restitution, and interest on surrender fees paid by investors, in settlement of allegations it aided an unregistered broker-dealer transact business in the state.

Notes: Copy of Order not on Department website, details of shared or suspended penalties not available.

Company: Bankers Life and Casualty Company and BLC Financial Services, Inc.
Description: Bankers Life and BLC agreed to pay $10.6 million to a group of states to resolve alleged violations of rules regarding the licensing of investment advisors.

In a follow-up from a 2008 multistate settlement involving it and Conseco, Bankers Life agreed to pay a total of $4 million to resolve allegations that it was not in compliance with several requirements of the earlier agreement.
Conseco agreed to an $11 million settlement to resolve multistate allegations regarding the administration of its Lifetrend policies.

Company: Conseco Senior Health Insurance Company and Bankers Life and Casualty Company
Description: Conseco and Bankers Life agreed to pay more than $2.3 million to resolve a multistate case concerning claims practices, complaint handling and marketing.

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
